intro: Korthalsia cheb, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, green, oval-shaped fruits that contain seeds. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a rough, leathery texture. Korthalsia cheb is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
